articles.title: Can Aston Villa sustain a title challenge?
articles.summary: Football Focus's Alex Scott, Nedum Onuoha and Glenn Murray look at Aston Villa's incredible Premier League form and whether they can sustain a title challenge this season.

articles.title: Who are the contenders to win Afcon?
articles.summary: BBC Sport's John Bennett gives Football Focus the lowdown on which nations are contenders to win the Africa Cup of Nations, which begins in Morocco on Sunday.

articles.title: Given shares Howe's frustrations on trio of decisions
articles.summary: Match of the Day's Shay Given shares Newcastle manager Eddie Howe's frustrations after a trio of decisions went against the Magpies in their 2-2 draw with Chelsea.

articles.title: How Man City smothered West Ham with 'suffocating' press
articles.summary: Match of the Day's Joe Hart looks at Manchester City's "suffocating" press as they looked back to their dominant best in a 3-0 win over West Ham.

articles.title: Gyokores penalty sends Arsenal top of the table in win against Everton
articles.summary: Arsenal striker Viktor Gyokores' first-half penalty sends the Gunners to the top of the Premier League table in win over Everton.

articles.title: Liverpool hold on to beat nine-man Spurs
articles.summary: Substitute Alexander Isak scores for Liverpool before being forced off with injury as Arne Slot's side win a chaotic Premier League match at nine-man Tottenham.

articles.title: Calvert-Lewin scores twice as Leeds thrash Crystal Palace
articles.summary: Dominic Calvert-Lewin extends his scoring streak to five Premier League games with a superb double as Leeds United secure a comfortable victory over Crystal Palace at Elland Road.

articles.title: Haaland scores twice as Man City beat West Ham
articles.summary: Erling Haaland scores twice to help Manchester City beat beleaguered West Ham United for a fifth straight Premier League victory which moved them top of the table.

articles.title: Broja heads home late equaliser for Burnley at Bournemouth
articles.summary: Armando Broja heads home a dramatic late equaliser as struggling Burnley end their seven-game losing streak by claiming a precious Premier League point at Bournemouth.

articles.title: Brighton & Sunderland's first ever PL match ends in 0-0 draw
articles.summary: Brighton's disappointing December run continues as they played out a goalless draw against Sunderland in the Premier League.

articles.title: Top and bottom at Christmas - what does it mean?
articles.summary: As we approach the halfway point of the season, what do the ghosts of Christmas past tell us about the Premier League title race and relegation battle?

articles.title: 'Do we want to be remembered for fighting or being cowards?'
articles.summary: Relegation from the Premier League looks inevitable for Wolves after a 15th defeat in 17 games - but will they avoid setting more unwanted records?

articles.title: Maresca hints at wanting older heads at end of chaotic week
articles.summary: Blues manager Enzo Maresca hints that having some more experience in his squad would be beneficial following their comeback to earn a point at Newcastle.

articles.title: Were Newcastle denied 'stonewall' penalty against Chelsea?
articles.summary: Newcastle United manager Eddie Howe says his side were denied a "stonewall" penalty in their 2-2 draw with Chelsea - so, does he have a point?

articles.title: Afcon to be held every four years from 2028
articles.summary: In a huge change to the football calendar, the Africa Cup of Nations will be held every four years from 2028 - switching away from biennial finals.

highlights.title: Premier League highlights this week - Week Highlights

articles.title: 'Luke is a different breed' - The NHS worker looking to upset Littler
articles.summary: David Davies says Luke Littler is a “different breed” but is hoping to cause a major upset when the pair meet in the second round of the World Darts Championship on Sunday night.

articles.title: Former winner Smith sent packing as emotional Bunting marches on
articles.summary: Former winner Michael Smith was sent packing from the World Darts Championship on Saturday as an emotional Stephen Bunting marched through.

articles.title: Team Kuchar hold two-shot lead over Team Daly at PNC Championship
articles.summary: Matt Kuchar and his college-bound son Cameron made birdie on all but three holes for a 15-under 57 to build a two-shot lead over John Daly and his college son in the PNC Championship on Saturday.
